CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. 12, reads: "Love's Labor's Lost...Sometimes Home is Where the Heart Remains - Formerly Brown's Property - Love, labor and purpose make houses and homes. Back in days when no Negroes lived on Wylie Avenue, Dr. Harry Brown built the above apartment building for his people.  The apartments passed through the hands of the Brown brothers and was finally bequeathed to a white friend by the late Dr. James E. Brown.  Negroes still occupy the apartments."
TitMainTitle: Three story brick apartment building with individual in top left window, man standing in arched doorway, and station wagon parked in front, 2535 Wylie Avenue, Hill District
